author: Drew Hinshaw
title: Latvian Bank Facing U.S. Sanctions Threat Wants Government Bailout
text:
RIGA, Latvia—A Latvian bank threatened with U.S. sanctions for allegedly conducting a global money laundering scheme, including for companies connected to North Korea’s missile program, is seeking more than a half billion dollars in government bailout money in an effort to stay afloat.
The accusations against ABLV Bank by the U.S. Treasury Department have ignited one of Europe’s biggest money laundering scandal in years and shined a spotlight on Washington’s efforts to go after Eastern European banks it says have ties to Russian...
